meanings.definition: Relating to vision in conditions of bright light.
meanings.sent1: The photopic vision allowed him to clearly see the details of the painting in the well-lit gallery.
meanings.sent2: She preferred to take photographs during the day when the photopic conditions made everything look vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The photopic lighting in the office was so bright that it felt like working under the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as photopic as a sunny day, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The photopic glow of the sunset painted the sky in brilliant hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the cone cells of the retina that function in bright light.
meanings.sent1: The photopic cone cells in her eyes allowed her to distinguish colors clearly in the daylight.
meanings.sent2: The photopic response of the retina to bright light is crucial for daytime vision.
meanings.sent3: His photopic eyesight was so sharp that he could spot a needle in a haystack under the sun.
meanings.sent4: The photopic cones in her eyes were like tiny suns, illuminating the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The photopic sensitivity of his vision made him squint in the bright midday sun.
